channel.title: Item help
channel.description: Fixed. You need 10,000 range, strength, and defence to wear the item. ;)

item.title: Item help
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

No no no, I get errors. My server doesn’t use sM, so I changed it to sendMessage, and I change a few things to fit to what the server uses, and I get either 100 errors or some weird errors.

item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

yeah, it is a noted ring, I know… I don’t remember the correct item ID… it doesn’t matter anyway, and your code didn’t work.

item.title: Item help
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Jay Sir Jay
item.description:
@Sir_Jay wrote:

Hmmm 1 sec, 2551 is a noted ring?

if (command.startsWith("item")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID == 2551 && playerRights < 2) { sM("you cannot fucking spawn this you glitching fuck"); return; } if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

Read full topic

item.title: Item help
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“chandlerethan, post:2, topic:375485”]for example this is my spawn command else if (command.startsWith("item")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item"); } } else { sendMessage("Bad item ID"); } }

you would add an: else if (newItemID == 2551 && playerRights < 1 ){
newItemID == randomID
}
else if (newItemId == 2551 && PlayerRights > 0 ){
newItemId == 2551
}
[/quote]
No matter how much I edit that code I get errors.

Read full topic
